The term "sociopathy" is generally not used in psychiatric diagnostic manuals to describe a specific mental health condition. Instead, the term "antisocial personality disorder" is used to describe a pattern of behavior characterized by a lack of regard for the rights and feelings of others.

The diagnostic criteria for antisocial personality disorder are outlined in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM), which is published by the American Psychiatric Association. The DSM is considered to be the industry standard for diagnosing mental health conditions in the United States.
